index.title: reactive frontend engineer
about.part1:
Dear guest,
Nice to see you! Greetings from San Francisco!
about.part2: Did I promise to tell about myself if you visit my web page? Let’s get started!
about.part3: The story of my relationships with web technologies begins in the distant 1999. When I created my first HTML-page about cats for programming class in the middle school. That page was awesome. I got an A for diligence and left to grow up. In 2008 we met again. But this time it was a serious long-term partnership.
about.part4: Since that time I've seen a lot. Battle of table and div layouts. I fought for divs. Carefully glued image sprites to create rounded borders. Yes, I was dreaming about border-radius for so long. I saw the dawn and sunset of jQuery. I remember how all script tags were moved from the head to the end of body all around the web. Bragged to server developers with my application on Express.
about.part5: In mid-2012, I was bored and I plunged into the world of server Java development. After 6 months of debugging errors in the console, I decided to test the sass, Backbone, and grunt. After that, I could not find the strength to come back.
about.part6: Todays I would love to create PWA and score 100 points on Google Lighthouse, write an app about barware (or whatever ware)) using React-native. And find a dream team to work together on great projects!
nomatch.head: Sorry, No match for
alx_1: Successfully implemented Agile methodology in distributed, multiple time zones team
alx_2: Managed all phases of the product development for dozens of custom solutions

alx_about: ADLUXE - creative technologies, Rich Media and Video Advertising Production
mail_1: Developed frontend for a Skyforge MMORPG social network. Created features integrated with core game’s systems
mail_2: Cross platform development for desktop, mobile, in-game (awesomium)
mail_3: Made 3 global redesigns of the product. Created custom css-framework
mail_5: Managed all frontend development (code style, code structure, style guides)
mail_6: Tech stack: tapestry framework (Java) with react.
mail_about: Mail.Ru Group is the largest Internet company in the Russian-speaking world and the leading Internet company in Russia, based on global monthly unique users.
ifree_1: Made dozens sites, landings, email newsletters, mobile portals using PHP
ifree_2: Developed admin web applications for managing advertisement campaigns using Ruby on Rails
ifree_3: Java EE: Web applications (front-end, back-end) using Spring MVC (Maven, JPA, JSP).
ifree_about: i-Free Group includes more than 20 IT-tech companies and start-ups focuses on mobile technology.

simai_2: TML/CSS/JS coding of web pages, improvement and optimization of existing interfaces, layout templates for 1C Bitrix.

skyforge.title: Skyforge MMORPG
sf.about: Skyforge is a free-to-play MMORPG set in a universe where fantasy and Sci-Fi collide. Players start as immortals trying to become mighty gods while protecting their planet, Aelion.
korsa.title: Korsa Media
korsa.about: Korsa Media is a leading event management agency with a portfolio of own brand events (Moscow City Racing, Kazan City Racing) as well as licensed events (Top Gear Live, Nitro Circus, FIA Formula E etc.)
korsa.1: This project is the result of collaboration with Nebula Digital team
korsa.2: Involved in all stages of the lifecycle including requirement gathering, design, development, testing and deployment
korsa.3: Developed frontend part of the project in a short time
rg-weather.title: Forecast app
rg-weather.about: Forecast for the next 7 days. Any city around the world. Build with Yahoo Weather. Flat design for city cards with background picture from Google Places or Flickr.
rg-youtube.title: Video search

lumene.about: Web site with seasonal events, discounts, promotions

madcall.title: MadCall Me
madcall.about: Madcall.me is a mobile service and application, that changes user's voice on the phone while talking. All users need to do is pick a voice, decide who they want to call and start having fun.
madcall.1: Created promo page for the first version of app
zombie.title: Tap to survive
zombie.about: Project made in I-FREE Academy. Multi-player survival game for iOS with promo page.
daosulta.title: Portfolio 2013
daosulta.about: Personal portfolio project made in 2013. The main goal was to implement landing page with trending (at that time) features.
daosulta.5: Experimented with build tools (grunt, gulp): image sprite generation and optimization, css autoprefixer, etc
rg.title: Portfolio 2017
rg.about: Single page application. Personal portfolio project. Place for experiments, spending evenings and weekends.
rg.1: Implemented internationalization with react-intl for English and Russian speakers. With browser language auto detect
rg.2: Continuous deployment with generous Netlify service
rg.3: All images are stored in Cloudinary CDN for fast and reliable delivery
rg.4: Favicon set is stored on Firebase CDN (since I am using them in multiple personal projects)
rg.5: Webpack: separate sets for development & production (webpack merge)
rg.6: Responsive components (on init and on resize)
rg.7: Flexbox for layout instead of grid libraries
rg.8: px free styles. Only relative units: rem & vw, vh
rg.9: Local component styles with CSS modules
